content:
Add a Milestone Action to an Entitlement Process

Milestone actions are time-dependent workflow actions that occur at every step (milestone) in an entitlement process. After you create an entitlement process and add milestones to it, add milestone actions to the milestones.

Available in both: Salesforce Classic and Lightning Experience
Available in: Professional, Enterprise, Performance, Unlimited, and Developer Editions with the Service Cloud

To add milestone actions to entitlement processes:

Manage Entitlements

AND

Customize Application

From Setup, enter Entitlement Processes in the Quick Find box, then select Entitlement Processes.
Click the name of an entitlement process.
Click the name of a milestone on the Milestones related list.

If you want to add a warning or violation action, add a time trigger first. After you add a trigger, the option to add a workflow action appears. Success actions use the milestone’s time trigger.

TIP If you want a violation action to fire immediately after the milestone is violated, set the time trigger to 0 minutes.

Click Add Workflow Action and select an option:

* New Task: Create a workflow task
* New Email: Create an email alert
* New Field Update: Define a field update
* New Outbound Message: Define an outbound message
* Select Existing Action: Use an existing action

NOTE Time-triggered actions only occur during your Salesforce org’s business hours. You can add up to 10 actions and 10 time triggers to each type of milestone action.
title: Service Cloud: Add Milestone Action to Entitlement Process
